summary: This is an email from a prosecutor in the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York requesting approval to order a daily transcript of the grand jury proceedings in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The email indicates evidence is being presented to the grand jury the next day and an indictment is likely soon.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email is about presenting evidence to a grand jury in his case, with an indictment likely soon.

events.title: Grand jury evidence presentation
events.description: Evidence is scheduled to be presented to the grand jury in the Jeffrey Epstein case.

keyFacts: A grand jury was actively hearing evidence in the Jeffrey Epstein case on or around June 18, 2019.
Prosecutors from the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York anticipated presenting an indictment soon.
The investigation was described as moving 'very quickly' at that time.
Prosecutors requested approval for a daily transcript to review the grand jury proceedings quickly.
